intro: Jehlia macrophylla, commonly known as the broad-leafed jehlia, is a striking evergreen shrub native to the eastern United States. It is characterized by its large, waxy, elliptical leaves that can grow up to 10 inches in length. The plant produces showy, bell-shaped flowers in shades of white, pink, and red, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for garden landscapes. It thrives in partial to full sun and well-drained soil, requiring minimal maintenance once established.
